snippet: Washington’s move to blacklist and marginalize the Haqqani network threatens the prospects for a political settlement — the only way out of the Afghan conflict.
abstract: Op-Ed article by authors Alex Strick van Linschoten and Felix Kuehn questions the wisdom of designating the Taliban-affiliated Haqqani network a 'foreign terrorist organization'; says blacklisting group limits American options in Afghanistan and gravely threatens prospect of political settlement, which is the only way out of the Afghan conflict.

byline.original: By ALEX STRICK van LINSCHOTEN and FELIX KUEHN

lead_paragraph: Washington’s move to blacklist and marginalize the Haqqani network threatens the prospects for a political settlement — the only way out of the Afghan conflict.

headline.seo: Blacklisting an Afghan Network Is Pointless
